item.title: Asia Stocks Seen Higher as US-China Talks Continue: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asia’s open should be buoyed by hints of progress in US-China trade talks following a muted session on Wall Street where stocks edged higher.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

item.title: Whirlpool Sells $1.2 Billion of Debt in First Junk-Bond Deal
item.description: Whirlpool Corp. priced $1.2 billion of high-yield notes Monday in the appliance maker’s first bond sale since being downgraded to junk.
item.dc:creator: Gowri Gurumurthy, Georgia Hall

media:content.media:description: A Whirlpool washer at a store in Orem, Utah.

item.title: S&P Downgrades Warner Bros. Bonds Deeper Into Junk Status
item.description: S&P Global Ratings cut Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.’s unsecured bond ratings deeper into junk status after the media company announced it was splitting up, and said that it’s reviewing downgrading other ratings of the company.
item.dc:creator: Dan Wilchins

media:content.media:description: Warner Bros. Studios in Burbank, California, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 2, 2023. Warner Bros Discovery Inc. released earnings figures on Aug. 3.

item.title: Korea’s Latest Credit Scare Clouds Funding for Riskier Firms
item.description: The surprise decision by a private equity-owned supermarket chain in South Korea to seek a court-led restructuring is reigniting jitters in the local credit market, creating an early test for the new administration of President Lee Jae-myung.
item.dc:creator: Haram Lim

media:content.media:description: A customer pushes a shopping cart inside a Homeplus Co. store in Seoul, South Korea, on Thursday, Sept. 20, 2018. Lim Il Soon became the chief executive officer of Homeplus, a $9.7-billion-a-year discount-store operator, in 2017 after she built a reputation among buyout funds for being a turnaround wizard. Prior to that, she had been chief financial officer at four companies since 1998, a rarity in a country with the lowest female representation in the OECD.

item.title: China’s Solar Industry Gathers as Gloom Deepens Over Demand
item.description: China’s despondent solar manufacturers face a new threat — an imminent drop-off in demand for their products that’s likely to heap pressure on an already oversupplied market.
item.dc:creator: Ocean Hou

media:content.media:description: Solar panels at a photovoltaic power station at the Dunhuang Photovoltaic Industrial Park in Dunhuang, Gansu Province, China, on Wednesday, Oct. 16, 2024. China is set to see another year of record solar installation as the nation pushes for a massive renewable buildout mainly in its interior.

item.title: Apple Should Encourage AI Apps, Portfolio Manager Says
item.description: Tony Wang, T. Rowe Price, Science & Tech Fund, Portfolio Manager speaking with Romaine Bostick and Alix Steel about Apple's WWDC and AI apps. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Apple WWDC: AI Competition to Stay Fierce, Analyst Says
item.description: Daniel Flax, Neuberger Berman, Senior Research Analyst speaks with Romaine Bostick and Alix Steel about Apple's WWDC. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Morgan Stanley Hunts for xAI Debt Buyers After Musk-Trump Feud
item.description: Morgan Stanley is reaching out to a broader pool of investors to shore up demand for a $5 billion debt sale for Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI Corp., a deal that offers a window into the fallout from the billionaire’s feud with US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Arroyo, Jill R Shah, Gowri Gurumurthy

media:content.media:description: The xAI logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Thursday, Dec. 7, 2023. Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI is seeking to raise $1 billion in funding from equity investors, according to a new filing.

item.title: RFK Jr. Removes All Members of CDC Vaccine Advisory Panel
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services is dismissing all 17 members that make up one of the main committees advising the US government on vaccine safety and policy, an unprecedented move to reshape a key scientific panel. “A clean sweep is needed to reestablish public confidence in vaccine science,” Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said Monday in an opinion piece published in the Wall Street Journal. The group, known as the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, or ACIP, reviews the latest data and makes recommendations to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which typically implements them. The group’s recommendations are influential and determine whether insurers cover shots, among other things. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Diageo Weighs Options for Stake in Indian Cricket Team
item.description: Diageo Plc is considering options for its ownership of the Indian Premier League cricket franchise Royal Challengers Bengaluru, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Anto Antony, Dinesh Nair

media:content.media:description: Members of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru huddle during the 2025 IPL Final match in Ahmedabad, India, on June 3. Photographer: Pankaj Nangia/Getty Images

item.title: Charter Schools Financier Blames Bankruptcy on Spat With Backer
item.description: A major financier of US charter schools filed bankruptcy, blaming pandemic-era subsidies that reduced demand for its services and a dispute with a top stockholder, New York investment firm Orthogon Partners Investment Management.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church, Jonathan Randles

item.title: Starwood REIT Begins to Scale Back Its Steep Withdrawal Limits
item.description: A real estate fund managed by Barry Sternlicht’s Starwood Capital is slowly lifting a cap on redemptions more than a year after it severely limited investors’ ability to retrieve capital.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Clark

item.title: US, China Hold Talks in London | Bloomberg Markets 6/9/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; Cornell University Tolani Senior Professor of Trade Policy, Brookings Institution Senior Fellow Eswar Prasad, Bloomberg's Felix Gillette and Ed Ludlow. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: ECB Rate Pause Until Autumn Makes Sense, Holzmann Tells ORF
item.description: The European Central Bank may be able to keep interest rates on hold over the summer, according to Governing Council member Robert Holzmann.
item.dc:creator: Zoe Schneeweiss

media:content.media:description: Robert Holzmann, governor of Austria's central bank, during a Bloomberg Television interview at the Kansas City Federal Reserve's Jackson Hole Economic Policy Symposium in Moran, Wyoming, US, on Friday, Aug. 23, 2024. Chair Jerome Powell said the time has come for the Federal Reserve to cut its key policy rate, affirming expectations that officials will begin lowering borrowing costs next month and making clear his intention to prevent further cooling in the labor market.

item.title: US Dollar Weakens Amid Trade Talks | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Ekes Out Gain as US-China Talks to Resume: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street traders glued to their screens amid commercial talks between the US and China drove stocks mildly higher, with officials hinting at progress in negotiations that are set to resume Tuesday. Bonds bounced after Friday’s selloff as inflation expectations eased. The dollar fell.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Global Market Strategist Anna Rathbun discusses the impact of a rare earths deal between the U.S. and China, and how the feud between Elon Musk and President Trump shook up Tesla shares. She speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.”

item.title: Robinhood Traders Playing S&P Index-Guessing Game Get Schooled
item.description: In the end, Robinhood Markets Inc. found itself caught in the same kind of trade its users favor: One driven more by speculation than certainty.
item.dc:creator: Emily Graffeo

item.title: Apple Isn't Even at the AI Party, Ross Gerber Says
item.description: "Siri is clueless and doesn't work," Ross Gerber, president and CEO of Gerber Kawasaki Wealth and Investment Management, says while discussing Apple's WWDC 2025. Speaking on "Bloomberg The Close," Gerber also says Steve Jobs would call Apple's new products "garbage." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Ekes Out Gain, Drifts Near Highs on US-China Trade Talks
item.description: US stocks crept closer to record highs on Monday, notching gains in five of the past six sessions as investors awaited the outcome of crucial trade talks between Washington and Beijing in London.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Apple OS Changes Will Give Users a New Experience: IDC
item.description: Nabila Popal, senior research director at IDC, says a change in OS across all of Apple's products will unify and increase the user "stickiness." She joins Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Paraguay’s President Deletes Bitcoin Post in Likely Crypto Scam
item.description: Paraguayan President Santiago Peña deleted a post on his X account after a likely hack by crypto scammers who claimed the South American nation had approved Bitcoin as legal tender.
item.dc:creator: Ken Parks

media:content.media:description: Santiago Pena, Paraguay's president, during a news conference at the Mercosur Leaders Summit in Montevideo, Uruguay, on Friday, Dec. 6, 2024. The long-delayed trade deal between the European Union and Latin America’s Mercosur bloc, which has been a quarter of a century in the making, was agreed to in principle in 2019 but has mainly been held up by French objections since.

item.title: US May Exhaust Debt-Ceiling Measures in Mid-August, CBO Says
item.description: The US government could run out of enough funds to meet its financial obligations in a timely manner between mid-August and the end of September, the Congressional Budget Office said Monday.
item.dc:creator: Jarrell Dillard

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, June 2, 2025. Significant changes are in store for President Donald Trump's signature $3.9 trillion tax-cut bill as the Senate begins closed-door talks this week on legislation that squeaked through the House by a single vote.

item.title: Apple Has to Fix Small Business Program Pricing: Hudson
item.description: Paul Hudson, creator of "Hacking with Swift", says he'd like to see Apple fix its pricing "scheme" in its Small Business Program. He joins Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Centerbridge Seeks $1 Billion to Hold Canadian Bank for Longer
item.description: Centerbridge Partners aims to raise about $1 billion to give it more time to hold its minority position in Fairstone Bank of Canada, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Preeti Singh

item.title: Banks Launch Debt for Bain Capital Buyout of Wingstop Franchisee
item.description: A group of Wall Street banks have launched the first part of a roughly $1 billion debt sale to fund Bain Capital’s acquisition of restaurant franchisee Sizzling Platter, which operates outposts of chains including Little Caesars, Dunkin’, Jersey Mike’s and Wingstop.
item.dc:creator: Jeannine Amodeo

media:content.media:description: A bag at Wingstop restaurant in New York.

item.title: JEPI Leads US Active ETFs By Assets; IBIT Outperforms | ETF IQ 6/9/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg ETF IQ" focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Today's guests: JPMorgan Investment Management head of US Equity Derivatives Hamilton Reiner and BlackRock head of Digital Assets Robert Mitchnick. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: BlackRock's Mitchnick on the Outperformace of 'IBIT'
item.description: BlackRock Inc.’s iShares Bitcoin Trust posted its largest-ever monthly inflow in May, as the original cryptocurrency climbed to a record while being touted by more proponents as an alternative store of value. BlackRock Head of Digital Assets Robert Mitchnick has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Allowing Access to Apple's AI
item.description: Carolina Milanesi, president and principal analyst at Creative Strategies, says Apple opening up its AI to developers allows for the company to prep for the future. She speaks with Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Why China May Need to Break Up Some Big Businesses
item.description: Ben Harburg, Novo Capital managing partner, says China is realizing that some of their biggest businesses may be getting "too big," with the Chinese government requiring them to be divested or broken up. He speaks with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech” on how this could help trade negotiations with the US. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Apple's New Design Language
item.description: Apple is expected to showcase a new redesign of its software across all its products at this year's WWDC. Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
